_thread_replies.text:
Hey Philip! What do you mean with “program subscriptions” and “subscription list”?
Could you give more details on what exactly we should be keeping an eye on?

elements.text:
Hey Philip! What do you mean with “program subscriptions” and “subscription list”?
Could you give more details on what exactly we should be keeping an eye on?

_thread_replies.text:
Hi <@U02BA3VS7H8>,
Thanks for looking at this.

Programs subscription is a new kind of Factor subscription that allows users to choose a meal plan around weight loss. This is determined by any subscription object that has `is_program_weightloss`  tag in the `subscription.productType.family.tags` object

Specifically, because a user can have multiple subscriptions, we had a scenario where the reactivation banner was being shown for a user with a standard active Factor subscription (because they had a deactivated program subscription). The solution was to move the Programs subscriptions to the end.

Ideally this should not impact users with a single subscription but it would impact users with multiple subscriptions especially for users with 1 active and 1 deactivate subscription. Validate
1.  the reactivation banner behavior doesn't change
2. Rewards/ Wallet section
3. Reactivation banner on the plans page (if any)
4. Share with Friends / Feed Friends section
5. Any other section that relies on order of subscriptions - such as banners
Ensure no side effects.

elements.text:
,

the reactivation banner behavior doesn't change
Reactivation banner on the plans page (if any)
Share with Friends / Feed Friends section
Any other section that relies on order of subscriptions - such as banners

_thread_replies.text:
So I guess it’s not supre relevant for us because we don’t allow double subscriptions.
But we will keep an eye.

Thanks Philip

This PR updates the api call for changing the delivery address in plan settings. This is part of the migration work from <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C087X11S06A/p1752761685435389>


:footprints: *Steps to reproduce:*
,

elements.text: APIv2 Delivery endpoints to STOP updating delivery information

services),

As a part of Consumer Core strategy and
we are in process of moving the source of truth of Deliveries information from Intfood to CDPS; introducing a
and taking over all the APIv2 endpoints that modify Delivery information.
To be able to achieve that, we need to take control of the traffic going to APIv2 Deliveries related endpoints. We ask all the clients of
move from APIv2 to the (fully compatible) CDPS Proxy until 31-July

This service is tested, live and handles existing APIv2 traffic coming from other clients successfully.

attachments.fallback:
[July 17th, 2025 7:14 AM] damian.tylczynski: :memo: *APIv2 Delivery endpoints to STOP updating delivery information*

Dear internal clients (*internal backend* services),

As a part of Consumer Core strategy and *Alliance KR* we are in process of moving the source of truth of Deliveries information from Intfood to CDPS; introducing a *new Deliveries API* and taking over all the APIv2 endpoints that modify Delivery information.

:arrow_right: To be able to achieve that, we need to take control of the traffic going to APIv2 Deliveries related endpoints. We ask all the clients of *these endpoints*:
• PATCH /subscriptions/{id}/delivery_dates
• POST /plans/{id}/changePlanDeliveryDetails
To *move from APIv2 to the (fully compatible) CDPS Proxy until 31-July*:
• Staging host: <http://cdps-deliveries-proxy.staging-k8s.hellofresh.io|cdps-deliveries-proxy.staging-k8s.hellofresh.io>
• Live host: <http://cdps-deliveries-proxy.live-k8s.hellofresh.io|cdps-deliveries-proxy.live-k8s.hellofresh.io>
This service is tested, live and handles existing APIv2 traffic coming from other clients successfully.

It is our only to switch the traffic to point these use-cases eventually to new source of truth. All the API calls that are pointing directly to APIv2 *will stop to update the Delivery entities* :warning: 

We *would like to know back from you* in the :thread: the feasibility of such change in your client.

Clients that we know about:
• BFF Reactivation - <@U068Q3LFB40> <@U0708FBKN30>.

attachments.fallback:
[July 11th, 2025 1:04 AM] damian.tylczynski: :memo: *"PATCH /subscription" for Delivery updates End of Life*

Dear Deliveries clients (*web, mobile & internal backend* services),

As a part of Consumer Core strategy and *Alliance KR* we are in process of moving the source of truth of Deliveries information from Intfood to CDPS; introducing a *new Deliveries API* and taking over all the APIv2 endpoints that modify Delivery information.

To be able to achieve that we ask all the clients that are using “*PATCH /subscription*” (mixing concern of many entities) for the purpose of changing delivery information to simply switch to existing APIv2 “*POST /plans/{id}/changePlanDeliveryDetails*” endpoint. This is the only way we can guarantee that the use-cases will be successfully supported after switching the source of truth to the new system. All the API calls that are being done to “*PATCH /subscription*” will stop to update the Delivery entities.

:hourglass_flowing_sand: *Due Date:* 31 July.

We see following clients (cc among others <@UEZ4PRFKM> <@U06L36ATUCD> <@U0708FBKN30>) updating the delivery option/interval using this endpoint:
• Android app
• iPhone app
• GreenChef Mobile App (Android)
• whitelabel-mobile/Everyplate
• whitelable-mobile/Youfoodz
• Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-window
• Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-address
• Web: /my-account/deliveries/menu
• Web: /settings/plan/delivery-address
• Web: /settings/plan/reactivate
• Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-interval
We have prepared <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPLAT/pages/5490737211/PATCH+subscription+for+Delivery+updates+End+of+Life|description of the change requested> and *we would like to know back from you* in the :thread: the feasibility of such change in your client.
attachments.text:
:memo: *"PATCH /subscription" for Delivery updates End of Life*

Dear Deliveries clients (*web, mobile & internal backend* services),

As a part of Consumer Core strategy and *Alliance KR* we are in process of moving the source of truth of Deliveries information from Intfood to CDPS; introducing a *new Deliveries API* and taking over all the APIv2 endpoints that modify Delivery information.

To be able to achieve that we ask all the clients that are using “*PATCH /subscription*” (mixing concern of many entities) for the purpose of changing delivery information to simply switch to existing APIv2 “*POST /plans/{id}/changePlanDeliveryDetails*” endpoint. This is the only way we can guarantee that the use-cases will be successfully supported after switching the source of truth to the new system. All the API calls that are being done to “*PATCH /subscription*” will stop to update the Delivery entities.

:hourglass_flowing_sand: *Due Date:* 31 July.

We see following clients (cc among others <@UEZ4PRFKM> <@U06L36ATUCD> <@U0708FBKN30>) updating the delivery option/interval using this endpoint:
• Android app
• iPhone app
• GreenChef Mobile App (Android)
• whitelabel-mobile/Everyplate
• whitelable-mobile/Youfoodz
• Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-window
• Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-address
• Web: /my-account/deliveries/menu
• Web: /settings/plan/delivery-address
• Web: /settings/plan/reactivate
• Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-interval
We have prepared <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPLAT/pages/5490737211/PATCH+subscription+for+Delivery+updates+End+of+Life|description of the change requested> and *we would like to know back from you* in the :thread: the feasibility of such change in your client.
